shortdesc.ph: Creates a data stream to improve reliability and ordering of data transmission.

p.codeblock: virtual int createDataStream(int* streamId, bool reliable, bool ordered) = 0;
public abstract int createDataStream(boolean reliable, boolean ordered);

section.note: Each user can create up to five data streams during the lifecycle of . The data streams are destroyed when you leave the channel. To continue using them, you need to recreate them. If you need a more comprehensive solution for low-latency, high-concurrency, and scalable real-time messaging and state synchronization, it is recommended to use real-time messaging.

Each user can create up to five data streams during the lifecycle of . Data streams are destroyed when leaving the channel. To continue using them, you need to recreate them. If you require a more comprehensive real-time messaging and state synchronization solution with low latency, high concurrency, and scalability, consider using Real-time Messaging.

section.title: Timing
section.p: You can call this method before or after joining the channel.
You can call this method before or after joining a channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After this method is successfully called, if the receiver does not receive the data within five seconds, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.
When reliable is set to , if the receiver does not receive the data within five seconds, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.

plentry.pd: Output parameter. The ID of the created data stream.

Whether to ensure the data stream is received by the receiver within five seconds:
: The receiver will receive the data from the sender within five seconds. If not received, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.
: The SDK does not guarantee that the data will be received within five seconds. Delay or loss will not return error information. Note: Make sure reliable and ordered are either both or both .

Whether to receive the data stream in the order it was sent:
: The receiver receives data in the order it was sent.
: The receiver does not receive data in the order it was sent.

pd.note: Make sure reliable and ordered are both set to or both set to .
pd.ph: Whether to guarantee that the receiver receives the data within five seconds:

ul.li: : The receiver will receive the data from the sender within five seconds. If not, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.
: No guarantee that the receiver receives the data within five seconds. No error callback is triggered for delay or loss.

plentry.pd:
Whether to receive data in the order it was sent:
: The receiver receives data in the order it was sent.
: The receiver may receive data out of order.

ul.li: On success, returns the ID of the created data stream.
